Justification: To assess the cognitive function and quantify the level of cognitive impairment.
To rule out structural causes of dementia such as brain tumors, strokes, or normal pressure hydrocephalus.
To exclude hypothyroidism as a reversible cause of cognitive impairment.
To check for deficiencies that can lead to cognitive decline.
To rule out anemia or infection that could contribute to cognitive symptoms.
To identify any imbalances that might affect cognitive function.
To rule out hepatic encephalopathy as a cause of confusion and memory issues.
To check for hypoglycemia or diabetes, which can affect cognitive function.
To rule out depression, which can mimic or exacerbate cognitive impairment.
To rule out seizure activity as a cause of confusion and memory loss.
